main event: A civilian observer spotted an aluminum-colored, round, flat, thin-disc-shaped object in the sky over Cliff, New Mexico on 22 April 1949.
interesting points: The object was observed for about two minutes before it disappeared behind the Mogollon Mountains.,The observer was driving into town when they noticed the object.,The object had an apparent size of over 15 feet in diameter.,The object was moving eastward at an altitude of about 20 degrees.,The observer, a retired teacher, appears to be reliable with no local police record.
sighted object: an aluminum-colored, round, flat, thin-disc-shaped object
